Requirements:
To be admitted with Regular Admission Status to the MAcc Program, applicants must meet the following requirements:

1. An undergraduate degree from a regionally accredited college or university.
2. An undergraduate GPA of at least 3.0 on a 4.0 scale.
3. An upper-division (junior and senior level courses) GPA in accounting of at least 3.0 on a 4.0 scale.
4. GMAT score of 500 or better. The GMAT is an essential component of the application and students must take the GMAT before being considered for admission to the MAcc program. However, students who meet one or more of the following criteria may waive the GMAT requirement:
   * An undergraduate overall GPA of 3.25 or higher from an AACSB accredited business school.
   * Passed all four parts of the CPA exam.
   * Hold a graduate degree from an accredited U.S. university.
   * Have five or more years of professional work experience in accounting.
   * Belong to Beta Alpha Psi (BAP) with a GPA of 3.25 or higher.
5. Completed the following prerequisite courses with a grade of C or better:
   * Financial Accounting (ACCT 200)
   * Managerial Accounting (ACCT 210)
   * Intermediate Accounting I & II (ACCT 300 & 301)
   * Cost Accounting (ACCT 310)
   * Accounting Information Systems (ACCT 320)
   * Income Tax I (ACCT 403)
   * Auditing (ACCT 410)
   * Principles of Management (MGMT 330)
   * Principles of Marketing (MRKT 340)
   * Corporation Finance (FINA 362)
   * Legal Environment of Business (BLAW 200)
   * Business Statistics (SCMS 255)
   * Micro Economics (ECON 201)
   * Macro Economics (ECON 202)
Program name: Master of Accountancy (MAcc)

Requirements:
To be considered for admission to the Master of Arts in Art and Design program, an applicant must have completed an undergraduate major in art or design, a related discipline, or have completed at least 30 semester credits of undergraduate studio art and art history. All applicants must meet the general requirements for admission to the College of Graduate Studies and Research. Admission to the Department of Art & Design will be based on the following:
1. Statement of Purpose: A letter stating the applicant’s intent in undertaking graduate study in art and design. This letter should describe the applicant’s specific area(s) of interest within the discipline as well as any relevant academic, professional, and personal experience.
2. Portfolio of Original Work: A portfolio of 15–20 examples of the applicant’s best and most recent work submitted as a single PDF. The portfolio should include a title page, a complete image list, and a table of contents.
3. Letters of Recommendation: Three current letters of recommendation from former teachers or others who have a direct knowledge of the applicant’s academic and/or artistic ability.
4. Official Transcripts: All post-secondary transcripts must be sent to the College of Graduate Studies.
5. Graduate Record Exam (GRE): Not required for this program.
6. Writing Sample: An academic writing sample may be requested by the graduate coordinator after a review of other required materials.
Program name: Master of Arts in Art and Design

Requirements: Completed application for admission to graduate study. Application fee (non-refundable). Official transcripts from all post-secondary institutions attended. GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale. A statement of purpose (no more than 500 words). Two letters of recommendation. International students are required to meet English Language Proficiency requirements.
Program name: Master of Arts in Communication and Media

Requirements:
Students must meet the admission requirements of the College of Graduate Studies and Research (mnsu.edu/grad).

Students seeking admission to the MA program in English must submit the following materials to the College of Graduate Studies and Research:

A writing sample that demonstrates the applicant's ability to succeed in the program's graduate coursework. The writing sample should consist of 8-15 pages of polished, academic writing that makes an argument about a literary or cultural text. The writing sample may be a single paper or two shorter papers.
A 1-2 page statement of purpose that explains the applicant's preparation for graduate study in English and his or her goals for the program.
Three letters of recommendation from individuals who are familiar with the applicant's academic work. At least two of the letters should be from former professors.
A curriculum vitae (CV) or résumé.
Official transcripts from all post-secondary institutions attended.
Program name: Master of Arts in English

Requirements:
In addition to the admission requirements of the College of Graduate Studies and Research, applicants must have:

1. A minimum GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale.
2. A bachelor's degree in English or English education. Students without an English or English Education background will be required to take up to twelve (12) undergraduate credits in English in order to satisfy deficiencies.
3. A statement of purpose explaining the applicant's reasons for wanting to do graduate work in English and what he/she hopes to do with the degree.
4. A critical writing sample of 5-10 pages.
5. Two (2) letters of recommendation from former professors or other professionals who can comment on the applicant’s academic potential.
Program name: Master of Arts in English Education

Requirements: To apply to the Gender & Women's Studies Master's Program, please submit the following through the College of Graduate Studies and Research application portal: Completed Graduate Application for Admission. Application fee. Official transcripts from all post-secondary institutions. Three letters of recommendation from individuals who can speak to the applicant's academic potential. A statement of purpose, approximately 500-1000 words, that addresses the following: The applicant’s experience in Gender & Women’s Studies or a related field; The applicant’s academic and career goals and how a M.A. in GWS will help meet those goals; Specific areas of interest in Gender & Women’s Studies; Why the applicant wants to pursue graduate study at Minnesota State University, Mankato. A writing sample of approximately 10-15 pages that demonstrates strong writing and analytical skills. The sample should be a formal academic paper, preferably written for an upper-division course. International students must also submit official TOEFL or IELTS scores that meet the minimum requirements of the College of Graduate Studies and Research.
Program name: Master of Arts in Gender and Women's Studies

Requirements: A complete graduate application consists of the following materials: Completed graduate application form and fee; Official transcripts from all undergraduate and graduate institutions attended, sent directly to the Graduate College; Personal Statement (limit 1,000 words): Discuss a.) your interests and career goals, b.) why you have chosen the I/O Psychology M.A. program at Minnesota State, Mankato, and c.) a significant accomplishment and a significant mistake.; Resume/CV; Three letters of recommendation; GRE is optional; Official TOEFL, IELTS, PTE, or Duolingo scores (for international applicants); Application deadline: January 15
Program name: Master of Arts in Industrial-Organizational Psychology

Requirements:
Admission to the M.A. in Literature and English Studies program requires the following:
- A baccalaureate degree from a regionally accredited institution.
- An undergraduate GPA of at least 3.0 on a 4.0 scale.
- A grade of B or better in at least 18 credits of upper-division (300-400 level) undergraduate English courses. Applicants with fewer than 18 credits may be admitted provisionally.

In addition to the online application and application fee, applicants must submit the following materials:
- Transcripts from all post-secondary institutions attended.
- Two letters of recommendation from former professors that speak to your potential for success in a graduate program.
- A personal statement (statement of purpose) of approximately 500-750 words.
- A critical writing sample of approximately 10-15 pages.
- A résumé
Program name: Master of Arts in Literature and English Studies

Requirements:
Baccalaureate degree from an accredited university.
A grade point average of at least 3.0 on a 4.0 scale.
Letter of intent which explains in 500 words or less why the student wishes to pursue this degree.
A résumé listing relevant work and/or volunteer experience.
Two letters of reference.
An academic writing sample (e.g. a paper written for an undergraduate course).
Graduate Record Examination (GRE) is not required.
TOEFL iBT of 79, IELTS of 6.0, Duolingo of 100, or PTE of 53 (if the undergraduate degree was not from an English medium university).
A personal interview may be required.
Program name: Master of Arts in Teaching English to Speakers of Other Languages

Requirements: Completed application to the College of Graduate Studies and Research. A bachelor’s degree from a regionally accredited university. An undergraduate GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale. (Applicants with an undergraduate GPA between 2.75 and 2.99 can be considered for provisional admission. Students admitted provisionally must earn a 3.0 GPA in the first nine (9) credits of graduate coursework to be moved to full admission status.) Official transcript from the institution where you earned your bachelor’s degree. Statement of purpose. (In two pages, double spaced, describe a) your reason for pursuing a Master of Arts in Teaching, b) your personal qualities and experiences that will make you a successful classroom teacher, and c) your commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion in education.) A professional resume. Names and contact information for two professional references. (A link will be sent to your recommenders to complete a recommendation form. At least one reference must be from a faculty member who can attest to your academic performance if you have graduated within the past 5 years. For applicants who have graduated more than five years ago, two professional letters of recommendation are acceptable.) For non-native English speakers, an English language proficiency test is required. A content review form verifying a major or a course equivalency in your intended licensure area. (This will be available within the online application.)
Program name: Master of Arts in Teaching: K-12 and Secondary Programs (MAT)

Requirements: To be considered for admission, applicants must submit the following: Application to the College of Graduate Studies and Research; Official transcripts from all post-secondary institutions attended (applicants must have an undergraduate degree from a regionally-accredited U.S. institution or a bachelor's-level equivalent from a foreign institution); GMAT or GRE test scores (a minimum GMAT score of 500 or an equivalent GRE score is expected for unconditional admission); A current resume; A 1-2 page statement of purpose (essay) that describes your reasons for pursuing the MBA degree, your short-term and long-term goals, and what you will bring to the MBA program at Minnesota State Mankato. The GMAT/GRE requirement is waived for applicants with one of the following: a cumulative undergraduate GPA of 3.0 or higher from a U.S. institution; an earned graduate degree (master's, doctorate, or professional degree) from an accredited U.S. institution with a cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher; five or more years of progressive professional work experience; active professional certification (CPA, CFA, CMA, or CSCP). Two letters of recommendation are optional for all MBA applicants.
Program name: Master of Business Administration (MBA)

Requirements:
In addition to the College of Graduate Studies and Research application requirements, the Creative Writing program requires the following:

A 10-25 page manuscript (double spaced, Times New Roman 12 pt font) of your best creative work in the genre in which you plan to study (poetry, fiction, or creative nonfiction). The manuscript may consist of several pieces or a single piece.
A one-to-two page statement of purpose, written in Times New Roman 12 pt font, explaining your reasons for pursuing an MFA degree in Creative Writing, your background in the field, your specific interests within your genre, and your goals for your time at Minnesota State University, Mankato. The statement of purpose is a professional document that should be well-written, carefully edited, and specifically tailored to our program.
Two letters of recommendation from individuals who can speak to your academic and creative abilities.
The undergraduate transcript.
The GRE is NOT required for admission to the Creative Writing Program.
Program name: Master of Fine Arts in Creative Writing

Requirements: In addition to the online application and application fee required by the College of Graduate Studies and Research, you must also submit the following directly to the Department of Theatre & Dance: A current resume. A 500-word statement of purpose which discusses your goals and objectives in seeking an MFA degree in Theatre Arts from Minnesota State University, Mankato. Three current letters of recommendation. A campus visit, which will include an interview and an audition or portfolio review. An audition is required for applicants in acting and musical theatre. A portfolio review is required for applicants in design/technology, directing, and dance. Applicants are considered for admission only after all application materials have been received.
Program name: Master of Fine Arts in Theatre Arts

Requirements: Admission to the MPH program is based on a holistic review of each student's application. Applicants must meet the admission requirements of the College of Graduate Studies and Research. In addition, the following are required for full admission to the MPH program: A baccalaureate degree from a regionally accredited college or university. An undergraduate GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale. A completed application submitted to the College of Graduate Studies and Research. Three (3) letters of recommendation. At least one recommendation must be from a former professor/instructor who can attest to the student's academic abilities. Recommendations from employers are also acceptable. A 1–2-page statement of purpose that includes: Reasons for interest in public health and the MPH degree at Minnesota State University, Mankato. Professional goals and aspirations. Strengths that will help you succeed in graduate school. Current resume or curriculum vitae. TOEFL scores (for international students only).
Program name: Master of Public Health (MPH)

Requirements:
In addition to the general requirements for admission to the College of Graduate Studies and Research, applicants for admission to the Master of Science in Advanced Dental Therapy program must have the following:

- Application for admission to the College of Graduate Studies and Research
- Official transcripts from all post-secondary institutions attended.
- Bachelor’s degree in dental hygiene from a CODA-accredited dental hygiene program OR Completion of a dental hygiene program and a bachelor’s degree in a related field from a regionally-accredited institution.
- Minimum 3.0 undergraduate GPA (on a 4.0 scale).
- Personal Statement/Essay addressing: Why you are choosing to further your education at Minnesota State University, Mankato. What are your future career goals? How will this degree help you achieve these goals? What is your philosophy of dental hygiene/dental therapy? Please include any experiences that have shaped this philosophy. Essay should be a maximum of 500 words.
- Current Resume/CV.
- Copy of current dental hygiene license.
- Copy of current CPR certification.
- Three letters of recommendation. It is preferred that two of the three letters come from faculty from the applicant’s dental hygiene program.
- Evidence of completion of 2000 dental hygiene practice hours. A completed and signed form will need to be submitted with application.
- Interview. Qualified applicants will be invited to interview.
- TOEFL (or other approved test) scores for international students.
Program name: Master of Science in Advanced Dental Therapy

Requirements:
In addition to the general requirements for admission to the College of Graduate Studies and Research, applicants for regular admission to the MS in Applied Anthropology must have:

1. A bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university.
2. An undergraduate GPA of at least 3.0 on a 4.0 scale.
3. 18 semester credits of undergraduate anthropology, including courses in cultural anthropology, biological anthropology, and archaeology.
4. A statement of purpose of 750 words, detailing why they are interested in the MSU Applied Anthropology program, and what their career goals are.
5. A recent sample of academic writing that demonstrates the applicant’s written communication skills.
6. Two letters of recommendation from individuals familiar with the student’s academic work.
7. Official transcripts from all post-secondary institutions attended.
Program name: Master of Science in Anthropology

Requirements: Applications for the professional master's degree program will be accepted through the Athletic Training Centralized Application Service (ATCAS). The priority deadline for applications is January 15th with an anticipated program start date in June of 2024. The program will continue to accept applications after the priority deadline until the cohort is filled. The following are required for admission: Completion of a bachelor's degree from a regionally accredited institution. Cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher on a 4.0 scale. Completion of prerequisite coursework with a minimum of a C or higher. 50 hours of observation with a Certified Athletic Trainer. These hours must be verified by the supervising athletic trainer. Submission of the ATCAS application which includes: Official transcripts from all institutions attended. Three letters of recommendation. At least one letter must be from a certified athletic trainer. Personal statement. Resume.
Program name: Master of Science in Athletic Training

Requirements: A four-year baccalaureate degree from a regionally accredited institution. A minimum GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale. If an applicant does not meet the 3.0 GPA requirement they may be considered for provisional admission if they submit a satisfactory Graduate Record Examination (GRE) score report (verbal 146, quantitative 142, and analytical writing 3.0). A resume or curriculum vitae. A statement of purpose (approximately 500 words). For International Applicants, if their native language is not English, a minimum TOEFL score of 550 paper-based, 213 computer-based, or 79 internet-based (with a minimum of 17 on speaking and 18 on writing), OR a minimum IELTS score of 6.5 (with no sub score below 5.5), OR a Duolingo score of 110.
Program name: Master of Science in Aviation

Requirements: Completed online Application for Graduate Study. Application fee. Official transcript(s) from every college or university where you have earned credit must be sent to the College of Graduate Studies and Research. GPA of 3.0 or higher on a 4.0 scale for the last 60 semester credits (90 quarter credits) of undergraduate coursework. A current resume. Three letters of recommendation from professional and/or academic sources who can speak to your potential for success in graduate school. You will be asked to list their names and email addresses in the online application. A two-page, double-spaced personal statement addressing the following: 1) Reasons for your interest in the College Student Affairs profession; 2) What you hope to gain from the CSA program; 3) Your potential contributions to the profession; and 4) How your identities and experiences have influenced your decision to pursue this profession. A recorded interview with three members of the CSA faculty. After a preliminary review of your application, you may be invited to complete an online interview.
Program name: Master of Science in College Student Affairs

Requirements: All prospective students must meet the general admission requirements of the College of Graduate Studies and Research, which are listed in the Graduate Bulletin. In addition, the Department of Communication Studies requires the following materials to be submitted for admission to the Master of Arts/Science program: Three letters of recommendation addressing your potential for successful graduate study. A 1-2 page Statement of Purpose describing your intellectual and professional goals, how these goals fit with the program at Minnesota State University, Mankato, your qualifications, and any relevant experiences. A 10-15 page writing sample that demonstrates your analytical skills, preferably a paper written for an undergraduate course. A resume or curriculum vitae. A bachelor's degree from an accredited institution. Applicants must meet the Minnesota State University, Mankato, College of Graduate Studies and Research requirements for admission. Generally, a grade point average of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale is required for full admission to a master's degree program. International Students: TOEFL score of 79 (iBT), IELTS score of 6.0, or Duolingo score of 110.
Program name: Master of Science in Communication and Media

Requirements: A baccalaureate degree from a regionally accredited institution. A minimum of 3.0 undergraduate GPA (based on a 4.0 scale). The Graduate Record Exam (GRE) is not required for admission. Successful completion of prerequisite courses.
Program name: Master of Science in Communication Sciences and Disorders

Requirements:
Baccalaureate degree, with a major in Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or a closely related field from a regionally accredited U.S. university or a recognized international university, with a minimum GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale.
GRE general test is not required.
Statement of purpose/letter of intent (optional)
Resume/Curriculum Vitae (CV) (optional)
International Applicants must additionally provide the following items:
An official transcript translated to English of all undergraduate and graduate coursework.
Official results of English proficiency exams (e.g., TOEFL, IELTS, Duolingo, etc.).
Please check the Graduate Studies International Student admission requirements page for more details.
Program name: Master of Science in Computer Engineering

Requirements: In addition to the general College of Graduate Studies and Research application requirements, applicants must have a minimum overall undergraduate GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale and the necessary background in Computer Science or a closely related field. Required application materials include a completed online application form and fee, official transcripts for all previous study, two letters of recommendation, a personal statement of purpose, and a curriculum vitae (CV)/resume. For applicants whose native language is not English, a minimum TOEFL score of 80 (with at least 17 on speaking and writing sections) or an IELTS score of 6.5 (with at least 6.0 on all bands) is required. The GRE is not required, but scores may be submitted to supplement an application.
Program name: Master of Science in Computer Science

Requirements: An undergraduate degree in computer science or a closely related field from a regionally accredited college or university. An undergraduate GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale. A grade of B or better in Data Structures and a grade of C or better in one programming course, Calculus I, and Discrete Mathematics (or their equivalents). For applicants who do not meet these requirements, they may be admitted on a provisional basis and be required to complete one or more undergraduate leveling courses before starting graduate-level coursework. International Applicants: A TOEFL score of 80 (with a minimum of 17 on speaking and writing sections), or an IELTS score of 6.5 (with a minimum of 6.0 on all bands). GRE scores are not required for admission. Application materials include an online application and fee, transcripts, a one-page statement of purpose, a current resume, and two letters of recommendation.
Program name: Master of Science in Computer Science and Information Technology

Requirements: A minimum GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale for the last two years of undergraduate study is required. A GPA below 3.0 may be considered if the applicant demonstrates a strong academic history in the last two years of their undergraduate degree and/or through their statement of purpose. Application materials for the CSP master's program are to be submitted online through the College of Graduate Studies and Research application portal. Applicants must submit the following materials: College of Graduate Studies Application, Application Fee, Official Transcripts, Three Letters of Reference, Statement of Purpose, Resume. All applicants who meet minimum admissions criteria will be invited to an online interview with CSP faculty.
Program name: Master of Science in Counseling and Student Personnel

Requirements:
In addition to the College of Graduate Studies and Research application requirements, the Department of Sociology and Corrections requires the following:

1. Baccalaureate degree with an overall GPA of 3.0 or GPA of 3.25 on the last 60 semester credits (90 quarter credits) of undergraduate coursework.
2. Official transcript from baccalaureate degree-granting institution.
3. A minimum of three (3) letters of recommendation. Letters should be from previous college instructors who can attest to the applicant's ability to complete graduate work or from individuals who have supervised the applicant in a professional criminal justice setting. Letters should not be from relatives, friends, or coworkers.
4. A one-to-two page Statement of Purpose outlining the applicant's motivation for pursuing an M.S. in Criminal Justice at Minnesota State University, Mankato, relevant past experiences, and future career goals.
5. Resume/CV.
6. The Graduate Record Exam (GRE) is not required for admission.
Program name: Master of Science in Criminal Justice

Requirements: To be considered for admission to the Educational Leadership master's program, you must: Have earned a bachelor's degree from a regionally accredited college or university. Have a cumulative GPA of at least 3.0 on a 4.0 scale. Submit an online application for admission and the non-refundable application fee to the College of Graduate Studies and Research. Submit official transcripts from all post-secondary institutions attended. Submit a resume. Submit a goal statement (1-2 pages) that summarizes your professional background and goals, and how this program will help you meet those goals. Submit two letters of recommendation.
Program name: Master of Science in Educational Administration

Requirements: To be considered for full admission, applicants must have a bachelor's degree from a regionally accredited institution with a grade point average of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale. Applicants must submit a professional statement that describes their purpose in seeking a graduate degree in Educational Leadership and their philosophy of leadership, a resume of professional experience, two letters of recommendation from persons qualified to assess potential for success in a graduate program, and an essay detailing their personal leadership history. An interview may be requested.
Program name: Master of Science in Educational Leadership

Requirements: To apply to the Educational Technology MS program, you must have an undergraduate degree from an accredited institution. Applicants must meet the admission requirements of the College of Graduate Studies and Research. There is no specific undergraduate major required for admission to this program. Applicants must have earned an undergraduate GPA of at least 3.0 on a 4.0 scale. Applicants must complete the online application. In the application you will be asked to upload the following documents: 1. Official transcripts from all post-secondary institutions attended. 2. Statement of Purpose. In an essay of at least 500 words, please explain: Why you want to earn this degree. What you plan to do after earning this degree. What experiences you have had with educational technology in the past. 3. Two Letters of Recommendation. Provide contact information for two people who are willing to write a letter of recommendation for you. The application system will then contact these people and ask them to upload their letter. We recommend that you contact these people ahead of time to make sure they are willing to write a letter for you. 4. Current resume. Your resume should document your post-secondary education, work experiences, and any volunteer or service activities. 5. $40 application fee.
Program name: Master of Science in Educational Technology

Requirements: An undergraduate degree in electrical engineering or a related field with a GPA of 3.0 or higher from an ABET-accredited program or a program in a school of recognized standing. Graduate Record Examination (GRE) is not required. If the student’s native language is not English, a minimum score of 79 on the iBT TOEFL with a minimum score of 17 on the speaking subtest, or a minimum score of 6.5 on the IELTS with a minimum score of 6.0 on the speaking subtest is required. A Statement of Purpose highlighting research interests and career goals. Students should indicate faculty members with whom they share research interests. The statement of purpose may be submitted as part of the online application. Two letters of recommendation. A resume or curriculum vitae (CV).
Program name: Master of Science in Electrical Engineering

Requirements: Admission to the graduate program in Elementary Education is based on a holistic review of the applicant's record and supporting documents. Minimum requirements for consideration for admission include: Undergraduate cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher on a 4.0 scale. Personal Statement/Letter of Intent/Statement of Purpose: Submit a 1-2 page statement describing why you would like to be an elementary teacher. Include any experience you have working with children, your philosophy of education, and your professional goals. Writing Sample: Please complete and submit ONE of the following writing prompts. The response should be 2-3 pages, double spaced. 1. Describe an experience you have had working with a child from a cultural background different from your own. What did you learn from this experience? How will this experience make you a better teacher? 2. Describe an experience where you had a disagreement with a person in a position of authority over you (e.g., teacher, supervisor, coach). How did you handle the situation? What did you learn from this experience that will help you when working with students, parents, or administrators? Three Letters of Recommendation: Submit the name and email address for three references that can attest to your academic ability and your dispositions for being an effective teacher. These should include at least one faculty member from your undergraduate program and one from a supervisor in a work or volunteer setting with children. Resume/Curriculum Vitae: Submit a current resume or curriculum vitae that includes any work or volunteer experience with children.
Program name: Master of Science in Elementary Education

Requirements:
In addition to the general application requirements for the College of Graduate Studies and Research, you must also submit the following items to be considered for admission:
Completed online application for admission to the College of Graduate Studies and Research.
Application fee.
Official transcripts from all post-secondary institutions attended. Transcripts from Minnesota State University, Mankato do not need to be requested.
Minimum GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale for the last 60 credits of undergraduate coursework.
Resume that details your work history including job titles and responsibilities, education, publications and/or presentations, and other professional activities.
Goal Statement. This essay should be 2-3 pages, double spaced and should describe your reasons for pursuing a master's degree in elementary teaching, your experiences working with children from diverse backgrounds, and the personal and professional characteristics you possess that will contribute to your success as an elementary classroom teacher.
Two letters of recommendation from individuals familiar with your academic work or experience working with children (e.g., college professors, supervisors).
Program name: Master of Science in Elementary Teaching

Requirements:
Applicants for the Master of Science in Engineering must meet the general requirements for admission to the College of Graduate Studies and Research. In addition, the following criteria must be met:

1. A bachelor’s degree in engineering from an ABET-accredited institution with a GPA of 3.0 out of 4.0. Applicants with a degree in a closely related field may be admitted provisionally. Students admitted provisionally must complete the assigned prerequisite undergraduate courses with a grade of B or better.

2. For international applicants only, please refer to the English Proficiency Requirements. For Fall 2024 admissions, the GRE exam will be waived.

3. Students must complete the application for admission. The application must include the following documents:

a. Official transcripts from all post-secondary institutions attended.

b. A statement of purpose describing research and career interests. The statement should be 1-2 pages in length.

c. Resume.

d. Names and email addresses of two recommenders who can speak to the applicant's ability to be successful in the program.

e. Applicants should apply by the deadlines established by the College of Graduate Studies and Research.
Program name: Master of Science in Engineering

Requirements: In addition to the College of Graduate Studies and Research application and minimum requirements, the English M.A. program requires: a bachelor's degree with a major in English, a minimum GPA of 3.0, a statement of purpose, a writing sample, and a letter of recommendation.
Program name: Master of Science in English

Requirements:
To be considered for admission into the Master of Science in English Language Studies program, an applicant must meet the general requirements for admission into the College of Graduate Studies and Research, and have submitted to the College of Graduate Studies and Research the following:

A statement of purpose (approximately 500 words) describing your academic and career background and goals and reasons for pursuing an MS degree in English Language Studies at Minnesota State University, Mankato.
A writing sample. It should demonstrate your best academic writing. While there are no length requirements, it should represent a significant engagement with a scholarly topic in language studies or a closely related field.
Two letters of recommendation from former professors or others familiar with your academic work. You will be asked to supply names and contact information of your recommenders during the online application process.
A curriculum vita (CV) or résumé.
Program name: Master of Science in English Language Studies

Requirements: Completed application for graduate study. Official transcripts from all post-secondary institutions attended. GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale. Three letters of recommendation from former professors or others able to judge the candidate’s potential for graduate study. A statement of purpose (approximately 500 words) describing your academic interests and professional goals, how the Ethnic and Multi-Cultural Studies Master’s Program will help you achieve those goals, and your experiences that have prepared you for our program. A writing sample of no more than 15 pages in length (e.g., term paper or published article). The writing sample should demonstrate the applicant's ability to research, analyze, and write at a high level. A résumé or curriculum vitae. The GRE is not required.
Program name: Master of Science in Ethnic and Multi-Cultural Studies

Requirements:
In addition to the College of Graduate Studies and Research application requirements, applicants must have a bachelor’s degree from a regionally-accredited college or university and must have a minimum 3.0 undergraduate GPA (on a 4.0 scale). The Department of Ethnic Studies has a holistic application review process. The department will consider applicants who do not meet the minimum undergraduate GPA if the other components of their application are strong. Applicants must submit the following:

*   A statement of purpose of about 500 words describing the applicant’s academic interests and goals, and how they relate to the Ethnic Studies program.
*   A writing sample of about 10-15 pages (e.g., a paper for an undergraduate course) that demonstrates the applicant’s writing and analytical skills.
*   Names and contact information of three references who can attest to the applicant’s academic abilities. (The system will then contact them for a letter of recommendation.)
Program name: Master of Science in Ethnic Studies

Requirements: A four-year baccalaureate degree from a regionally accredited institution. A minimum undergraduate GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale. Completed prerequisite coursework: Human Anatomy and Physiology I and II with labs; Chemistry I and II with labs; College Algebra; Physics I and II with labs; Exercise Physiology with lab; Biomechanics with lab; Statistics. The GRE is not required. International students must have a minimum TOEFL score of 80 with a minimum of 17 on each of the speaking and writing sections; OR IELTS score of 6.5 with a minimum of 6.0 on each of the speaking and writing sections; OR Duolingo score of 110.
Program name: Master of Science in Exercise Physiology

Requirements: Completed Application for Admission to the College of Graduate Studies and Research. A minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale for the most recent 60 semester credits of undergraduate coursework, which must include at least 15 credits of 300- or 400-level coursework. A curriculum vitae or resume detailing educational background, work experience, research experience, professional activities and affiliations, publications, and presentations. A statement of purpose (1-2 pages) that describes a) your educational and professional background, b) your educational and professional goals and how this degree will help you achieve them, and c) faculty with whom you may be interested in working. Three letters of recommendation submitted from individuals familiar with your academic and professional abilities. A bachelor’s degree from a regionally accredited college or university in exercise science or related field. Completion of the following prerequisites or their equivalents with a C or better: Human Anatomy, Human Physiology, Exercise Physiology, Biomechanics, English Composition, Statistics. Note that students may be admitted conditionally if they have not yet completed all prerequisites. In such cases, all prerequisites must be completed within the first two semesters of enrollment.
Program name: Master of Science in Exercise Science

Requirements:
Applicants must meet the College of Graduate Studies and Research’s admission requirements. In addition, the applicant must also submit the following directly to the College of Graduate Studies and Research:

A bachelor’s degree from an accredited university.
An undergraduate GPA of 3.0 or higher.
A statement of purpose (1-2 pages) that describes a) your educational and career goals and how the M.S. in Gender and Women’s Studies will help you to reach them and b) your familiarity with gender and women’s studies and topics you hope to research.
A writing sample (8-10 pages) that demonstrates your analytical and writing abilities. You may submit an essay from an undergraduate course.
A resume/curriculum vita.
Names and contact information of three recommenders. Recommenders will be contacted by the university with instructions for submitting a letter of recommendation. We prefer at least one recommender to be a professor who can speak to your academic abilities.
Program name: Master of Science in Gender and Women's Studies

Requirements:
A bachelor's degree from an accredited university.
A GPA of 3.0 or higher.
The Graduate Record Examination (GRE) is NOT required.
At least 12 semester credits in Geography or a related field.
A personal statement of career goals and research interests.
Three letters of recommendation.
International applicants must also provide results of the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) as part of their application. A minimum iBT score of 79, with minimum subscores of 17 on the Writing and Speaking sections is required for admission to the College of Graduate Studies.
Program name: Master of Science in Geography

Requirements: In addition to the general requirements for admission to the College of Graduate Studies and Research, applicants for admission to the Master of Science program in History must have a cumulative undergraduate grade point average of at least 3.0 on a 4.0 scale. Applicants must submit a writing sample of at least five pages in length, a statement of purpose, and two letters of recommendation from former professors. All materials will be evaluated by the History Department's graduate committee. Graduate Record Exam (GRE) scores are NOT required for admission to the program.
Program name: Master of Science in History

Requirements: A four-year baccalaureate degree from a regionally accredited institution. A minimum GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale. A completed online application. Official transcripts from all post-secondary institutions attended. A Statement of Purpose. Resume. Two letters of recommendation. For non-native English speakers, an official TOEFL score report with a minimum score of 79 or an official IELTS score of 6.0. GRE is not required.
Program name: Master of Science in Information Technology

Requirements:
The requirements for admission to the Master of Science in Manufacturing Engineering Technology program are:
A four-year bachelor's degree in Engineering Technology or related field with a GPA of 3.0 out of 4.0 from an accredited university or college.
Official transcripts of all previous undergraduate and graduate work.
A statement of purpose (500-1000 words).
The Graduate Record Examination (GRE) is NOT required for admission to the MSMET program.
A list of three references with full contact information.
Program name: Master of Science in Manufacturing Engineering Technology

Requirements:
In addition to the general requirements for admission to the College of Graduate Studies and Research, applicants for admission to the Master of Science program in Mathematics and Statistics must have:
1. A completed Application for Graduate Study.
2. A $40 non-refundable application fee.
3. Official transcripts from all post-secondary institutions attended. Transcripts from Minnesota State Mankato do not need to be submitted.
4. One official letter of recommendation. Recommenders must be familiar with the applicant’s academic work. The recommender should address the following: work ethic, perseverance, ability to work independently, and ability to handle abstract concepts. Recommenders should submit the letter through the online application system.
5. An undergraduate degree in mathematics, statistics, or a related field with at least a 3.0 GPA on a 4.0 scale.
6. A statement of purpose outlining the applicant's mathematical and statistical background, interests, and professional goals.
7. GRE scores are optional.
Program name: Master of Science in Math and Stats

Requirements: Applicants must complete the Graduate Studies application, pay the application fee, and submit official transcripts. A cumulative undergraduate grade point average (GPA) of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale is required for full admission status. Required documents include three letters of recommendation, a 2-3 page Statement of Purpose, and a current resume. GRE scores are not required for admission. After a preliminary screening of all completed application files, selected applicants will be invited to a required on-campus interview.
Program name: Master of Science in Mental Health Counseling

Requirements:
To apply to the Master of Science degree in Recreation, Parks and Leisure Studies, you need:
A completed Application for Graduate Study.
A baccalaureate degree from a regionally accredited college or university.
A GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale. (Students with a GPA between 2.7 and 2.99 may be considered for provisional admission).
Official transcripts from all post-secondary institutions attended.
Two letters of recommendation.
A statement of purpose. This statement should address your background, interests, and goals related to the field of recreation, parks and leisure studies.
A current resume.
A score of 500 on the paper-based test, or 173 on the computer-based test, or 61 on the internet-based test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) for all non-native English speakers.
An interview with a RPLS graduate faculty member may be required.
Program name: Master of Science in Parks, Recreation and Leisure Studies

Requirements: A bachelor's degree from a regionally accredited college or university. A minimum GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale. A completed online Graduate Application. Official transcripts from all post-secondary institutions attended. A current resume. Two letters of recommendation from individuals familiar with your academic or professional background. A personal statement of 500-700 words addressing your professional goals and how this program will help you achieve them. GRE scores may be waived with a GPA of 3.25 or higher or a previously earned Master's degree.
Program name: Master of Science in Reading

Requirements: To be admitted to the Master of Science in Special Education degree program, an applicant must have a baccalaureate degree from a regionally accredited college or university. Applicants must also submit the following to the College of Graduate Studies and Research: 1. An application for graduate study. 2. Official transcripts from all post-secondary institutions attended. A GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale is required for full admission. Applicants with a GPA lower than 3.0 must submit Graduate Record Exam (GRE) scores. 3. Three letters of recommendation. 4. A letter of application/personal statement indicating interest and abilities for working with exceptional individuals. 5. International students should also refer to the additional requirements at the College of Graduate Studies website.
Program name: Master of Science in Special Education

Requirements:
In addition to the College of Graduate Studies and Research admission requirements, applicants must also meet the following program requirements:
1. Complete an application for admission.
2. Pay the application fee.
3. Provide an official transcript from the institution that awarded your bachelor's degree. We reserve the right to request all transcripts.
4. Applicants must have a minimum GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale. Applicants not meeting the 3.0 GPA requirement may be admitted provisionally.
5. A one-page typed letter of intent/goal statement explaining your reasons for pursuing a master’s degree in special education.
6. Two letters of recommendation from individuals able to attest to your ability to do graduate-level work.
7. A writing sample using the provided prompt.
8. A Minnesota Teaching License is not required for admission into the program but will be necessary to obtain a special education teaching license.
Program name: Master of Science in Special Education and Teaching

Requirements:
In addition to the general requirements for admission to the College of Graduate Studies and Research, applicants for admission to the Master of Science in Technical Communication program are required to have:
1. A bachelor’s degree from a regionally accredited college or university.
2. A minimum grade point average of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale for the last two years of undergraduate coursework.
3. Non-native English speakers must meet the University's English language proficiency requirements.
In order to be considered for admission to the program, applicants must submit the following materials:
1. Completed Application for Admission to Graduate Study.
2. Application fee.
3. Official transcripts from all post-secondary institutions attended.
4. Two letters of recommendation from individuals such as professors or employers who are in a position to evaluate the applicant's potential for graduate study in technical communication.
5. Statement of purpose indicating why you are seeking a degree in technical communication.
6. Resume or curriculum vita.
7. Writing sample of no more than 15 pages that demonstrates your potential for success in a graduate program in technical communication.
The GRE is not required for admission to the program.
Program name: Master of Science in Technical Communication

Requirements: Undergraduate degree from a regionally accredited college or university. Undergraduate cumulative grade point average (GPA) of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale. If undergraduate GPA is below 3.0, applicant may be considered for provisional admission based on a combination of other factors, including: GPA in last 60 credits, GPA in major, work experience, etc. An admission essay will be required. Required Application Materials: Official transcript(s) from all post-secondary institutions attended. Resume highlighting relevant experiences. Personal Statement explaining applicant's reasons for pursuing this degree, including relevant personal and professional experiences. In addition, the statement should describe the applicant's plan for success in a graduate program, especially related to the online environment. Two letters of recommendation from professional or academic references who can speak to your potential for success in a graduate program and in the field of education.
Program name: Master of Science in Teaching: Elementary Education

Requirements:
To be admitted to the K-12 and Secondary Graduate Teacher Licensure program and/or Master of Science in Teaching program, a prospective student must meet the following minimum admission requirements:

1. Complete the Minnesota State University, Mankato Graduate Studies Application.
2. Pay the application fee.
3. Submit official transcripts from all previous undergraduate and graduate institutions. A minimum GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale is required for the last 60 credits of undergraduate coursework.
4. Submit official scores from the Minnesota Teacher Licensure Exam (MTLE) basic skills tests (Reading, Writing, and Mathematics) OR official ACT Plus Writing, SAT, or GRE test scores.
5. Submit an original written essay, not to exceed two double-spaced pages, responding to the prompt available in the Graduate Studies application system.
6. Submit a resume outlining your education, work, and volunteer experience.
7. Three letters of recommendation addressing your potential for success in a graduate program and potential as a future teacher.
8. A successful interview with faculty from the licensure area to which you are applying. You will be contacted to arrange an interview after all other application materials are received.
Program name: Master of Science in Teaching: K-12 and Secondary Programs

Requirements: GPA: 3.0. A completed bachelor's degree in any field. Official transcripts from all institutions attended. A letter explaining why you are interested in becoming a Special Education teacher (this will serve as a writing sample). A resume listing educational and work experiences. One letter of recommendation that can speak to applicant's character, work ethic, and ability to be successful in the program. International Applicants must also meet the international graduate student requirements.
Program name: Master of Science in Teaching: Special Education

Requirements: To be considered for admission into the Traditional MSW Program, students must have the following: A baccalaureate degree from a regionally accredited college or university. A degree in any field is acceptable for the traditional program. A minimum undergraduate GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale for the last two years of the undergraduate degree OR an overall GPA of 2.75. Liberal arts background including course content in social and behavioral sciences, humanities, and biological sciences. Demonstrated commitment to social work values. A graduate application to the College of Graduate Studies and Research (separate from the MSW application). Applicants who meet the admission criteria will be invited for a required interview. Interviews are conducted by faculty and community members. Students must have completed an undergraduate statistics course with a grade of C or better within five years prior to admission. An undergraduate research methods course is also recommended.
Program name: Master of Social Work (MSW)

Requirements: Applicants for admission to the PSM in CSIT must meet the general requirements of the College of Graduate Studies and Research and also have at least an undergraduate degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or a closely-related field. They also need to have successfully completed undergraduate courses in calculus I, discrete mathematics, data structures, and object-oriented programming with a grade of at least C. To apply, the applicant should submit the following: 1. A completed graduate application form. 2. One official transcript from each college and university attended. 3. A statement of purpose about career goals and reasons for applying to this program. 4. A resume. 5. Two letters of recommendation. 6. An undergraduate GPA of at least 3.0 out of 4.0. 7. A test score of English proficiency (for international students only).
Program name: Professional Science Master's in Computer Science and Information Technology

Requirements:
The application for graduate study at Minnesota State University, Mankato is completed online through the College of Graduate Studies and Research. The application process is selective, admitting only those students who have demonstrated the potential to be successful educational leaders. We review the total application for evidence of this potential.

The application requires the following:

Application form and fee
Official transcripts must be sent to the College of Graduate Studies and Research directly from the institution
Personal statement
Resume/curriculum vitae
Three letters of recommendation
A current copy of your Minnesota teaching license (Superintendent & Director of Special Education applicants)
A copy of your Minnesota principal license (K-12 Principal applicants)
A copy of your principal license or evidence of completed coursework (Superintendent applicants)
The Educational Leadership Department at Minnesota State University, Mankato does not require the GRE for admission to its graduate programs.

The College of Graduate Studies and Research requires a minimum GPA of 3.0 for admission.
Program name: Specialist in Educational Leadership

Requirements:
Completed Online Application
Official transcripts from all post-secondary institutions attended. Transcripts must be sent from the institutions directly to the College of Graduate Studies and Research.
A current résumé that describes professional accomplishments and community involvement.
A personal statement/essay of no more than three double-spaced pages describing:
    The applicant’s interest in the doctoral program.
    How the applicant’s professional goals align with the program.
    What the applicant brings to the program and to the cohort.
    The applicant’s perceptions about his/her greatest challenges in beginning a rigorous doctoral program and how s/he might respond to those challenges.
Three letters of recommendation attesting to the applicant’s leadership skills and potential for success in a doctoral program. One letter must be from a current supervisor. One must be from a faculty member who can attest to the applicant's potential for academic success in a doctoral program.
A scholarly writing sample of which you are the sole author. Examples include, but are not limited to, a master’s thesis or paper, a published article, or a grant proposal.
Applicants must have a Master's degree from a regionally accredited institution.
A minimum graduate GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale is required. In some circumstances, applicants with a graduate GPA below 3.0 may be considered for provisional admission.
Evidence of successful leadership experience.
Successful completion of a screening interview with department faculty.
Program name: Doctor of Education in Educational Leadership

Requirements: Completed online application. Official transcripts from all post-secondary institutions attended. Copy of current administrative license or verification of eligibility for a license. Documentation of a minimum of three years of licensed administrative experience. Current resume or vita. Statement of professional and scholarly goals. Writing sample: A three-page (maximum), double-spaced scholarly writing sample addressing the following topic: Identify a significant issue confronting educational leaders. Discuss how the issue influences student learning and how your leadership would address this issue. Three letters of recommendation.
Program name: Doctorate in Educational Administration

Requirements: All DNP applicants must meet the following criteria: Baccalaureate degree in nursing from a program accredited by a national nursing accreditation body (ACEN or CCNE). A master’s degree in nursing is preferred. Minimum GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale for undergraduate nursing degree. Current, unencumbered license as a Registered Nurse in Minnesota by the time of first clinical course. Minimum of one year of full-time work experience (or its part-time equivalent) as a registered nurse. Successful completion of an undergraduate or graduate-level statistics course with a grade of C or better is required prior to enrollment. Upon admission, all students will be required to complete a background study. An interview with graduate nursing faculty may be required.
Program name: Doctorate in Nursing Science, Education, and Practice

Requirements:
Complete the Minnesota State Mankato Graduate Studies Application.
Application fee
Two Official Transcripts
Have a minimum GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale.
A master's degree in counseling or a related field from a CACREP accredited program, or its equivalent. A student who graduates from a non-CACREP program will be required to have their curriculum reviewed by a faculty committee to determine any missing coursework. Any missing coursework will be required to be completed post-admission as determined by the faculty committee.
Applicants who have a master's degree in a related field and do not have a license to practice counseling will be required to complete all requirements for licensure as part of their program of study.
Three letters of recommendation from faculty members or other persons who have knowledge of the applicant's academic and professional competence or potential.
Vita or résumé.
A statement of purpose of 500-1000 words describing your professional goals and aspirations relating to your interest in a doctoral degree in counselor education and supervision.
A writing sample from your master's program coursework.
An on-campus interview.
International students have additional admission requirements.
Program name: Doctorate in School Counseling and Guidance Services

Requirements: Applicants must have a bachelor’s degree from a regionally accredited college or university and a minimum grade point average of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale. Required coursework includes successful completion of at least 18 undergraduate or graduate semester credit hours in psychology, including coursework in statistics, research methodology, child or human development, and abnormal psychology. As part of the online application, you will need to upload a Resume/Vita, a Statement of purpose/autobiographical statement (double spaced, 2-3 pages), and a Writing Sample (a professional paper that demonstrates your academic writing skills). Graduate Record Exam (GRE) General Test scores are not required for admission. Selected applicants will be invited for an on-campus interview.
Program name: Doctorate in School Psychology

Requirements: Baccalaureate degree with a major in health science, community health, school health, nursing, nutrition/dietetics, exercise science, athletic training, or a related field from an accredited institution. GPA of at least 3.0 on a 4.0 scale. To apply to this program, please submit the following: An application for graduate study, Transcripts from all previous institutions, Two letters of recommendation
Program name: Certificate in Applied Health Science

Requirements: A bachelor’s degree from a regionally accredited college or university is required for admission. An official transcript from the institution that awarded your bachelor’s degree. A cumulative GPA of at least 3.0 on a 4.0 scale is required for admission. One Letter of Recommendation.
Program name: Certificate in Educational Technology

Requirements: An earned baccalaureate degree from a regionally accredited U.S. institution or a comparable degree from an international institution. A minimum undergraduate grade point average of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale. Prerequisites: Financial Accounting, Managerial Accounting, Intermediate Accounting I & II. Admission is rolling and applicants may begin the program in the fall or spring semester. To apply to this program, you will need to submit: Online application, Application fee, Official transcripts from all undergraduate and graduate institutions, Official test scores (if applicable). International students have additional admission requirements.
Program name: Graduate Certificate in Accounting

Requirements: Submit an application to the College of Graduate Studies and Research. Submit official transcripts from all post-secondary institutions attended. Submit two letters of recommendation. Statement of goals for pursuing the certificate. International applicants have additional admission requirements.
Program name: Graduate Certificate in Aging Studies

Requirements: Application requirements are the same as for the M.A. and M.S. degree, however, GRE scores are not required. International students should consult with the Kearney Center for International Student Services to determine is a student visa can be obtained for this certificate program. The M.A. and M.S. application requirements include: A bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university, a cumulative GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale, a completed online application form, a non-refundable application fee, a statement of purpose (500-750 words), a writing sample, a resume or CV, three letters of recommendation, and official transcripts from all post-secondary institutions attended.
Program name: Graduate Certificate in Communication and Media

Requirements:
To be admitted to the graduate certificate program in computer science, applicants must meet one of the following requirements:

1. Hold an MS degree in computer science or a closely related field.
2. Be a currently enrolled MSCS student in good standing at Minnesota State University, Mankato.
3. Hold an undergraduate degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or Computer Information Technology and a GPA of 3.0 or higher.

Students who do not meet these requirements may be provisionally admitted to the program. Please contact the department for more information.
Program name: Graduate Certificate in Computer Science and Information Technology

Requirements:
Admission to the College Student Affairs graduate certificate program is on-going and is offered both on-campus and online.

Application Requirements
1. Complete the online application for admission.
2. Submit official transcripts from all post-secondary institutions attended.
3. Pay the application fee.
4. Submit a Personal Statement. In this statement, you should address:
    a. Your professional aspirations and how the College Student Affairs certificate program will help you meet those aspirations
    b. What experiences you have had with people who are different from you (e.g., culturally, racially, ethnically, socioeconomically, etc.).
    c. Any additional information you feel would be helpful to the selection committee in reviewing your application (e.g., unique experiences, abilities, etc.).
5. Resume/Curriculum Vitae.
6. Three letters of reference.
7. A cumulative GPA of at least 3.0 on a 4.0 scale for the bachelor's degree is required for admission.
Program name: Graduate Certificate in Counseling and Student Personnel

Requirements: An undergraduate degree from a regionally accredited university. A minimum undergraduate GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale. A one-page statement of purpose explaining the student's background and interest in the program. Two letters of recommendation. A resume or curriculum vitae. The Government Department does not require GRE scores for admission.
Program name: Graduate Certificate in Criminal Justice

Requirements:
Admission to the certificate program is competitive and requires the following:

An earned Bachelor's degree from a regionally accredited institution.
A cumulative grade point average (GPA) of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale for the Bachelor's degree.
At least 3 years of P-12 teaching, educational leadership, or comparable experience (e.g., student support personnel, district office support staff, etc.)
Two references from individuals who can speak to the applicant's leadership potential.
Submission of a written essay that responds to the prompt: What is the purpose of P-12 education, and what are the primary barriers to achieving that purpose? (The essay will be evaluated on the following criteria: clarity of thought, depth of insight into the topic, quality of the writing, organization, focus, voice, and conventions).
Submission of the online application and fees to the College of Graduate Studies and Research.
Program name: Graduate Certificate in Educational Leadership

Requirements:
Completed application for graduate study.
Official transcripts of all undergraduate and graduate coursework.
A three- to five-page statement of purpose that explains the applicant’s interest in the particular certificate and how certificate coursework will benefit the applicant’s professional and/or personal goals.
A writing sample that demonstrates the applicant’s skills in critical analysis and argumentation (10-15 pages for certificates in Literature and in Rhetoric & Composition; 20-25 pages of creative prose or 10-15 pages of poetry for the certificate in Creative Writing).
Three letters of recommendation.
A curriculum vitae or resume.
GRE scores are not required.
Program name: Graduate Certificate in English

Requirements: Completed application for graduate study. Official transcripts from all post-secondary institutions attended. A GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale is required for admission. Two letters of recommendation. Personal statement addressing your experience working with English learners, your reasons for pursuing a graduate certificate, and your career goals. Resume or curriculum vitae (CV). For non-native speakers of English, a score report of the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL), International English Language Testing System (IELTS), Pearson Test of English Academic (PTE A), or Duolingo is required.
Program name: Graduate Certificate in Teaching English to Speakers of Other Languages

Requirements: Apply through the College of Graduate Studies and Research. Submit ALL official college and university transcripts showing a cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher. For individuals with a GPA below 3.0, please contact the program coordinator. Provide evidence of a degree-equivalent major from a regionally accredited college or university in the content area for which the applicant is seeking licensure OR provide evidence of having passed the appropriate Minnesota Teacher Licensure Examination (MTLE) content exam. Submit a one-page essay outlining your commitment to the profession and reasons for wanting to become a teacher. Provide the name and email address of two references. They will receive an email from the university with a link to a recommendation form. Submit a résumé. Interview with program faculty.
Program name: Graduate Certificate in Teaching: K-12 and Secondary Programs

Requirements: Completed application for graduate study. Official transcript showing an earned baccalaureate degree from a regionally accredited institution with a GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale. A current Minnesota teaching license.
Program name: Graduate Certificate in Teaching: Reading

Requirements: A bachelor's degree from a regionally accredited college or university. A minimum GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale for the last 60 semester credits of undergraduate coursework. Students applying for the Graduate Certificate are required to submit an application and be accepted into the College of Graduate Studies and Research. The application is located online at mnsu.edu/apply. Submit an official transcript from the institution where the bachelor's degree was earned. Must be admitted to the Professional Education sequence. Complete and pass the MTLE Basic Skills Tests (Reading, Writing, and Mathematics). Note: A waiver may be requested from this requirement if an applicant meets the criteria outlined on the waiver form. Submit two letters of recommendation from professional or academic sources that can speak to your professional dispositions and academic potential. These are submitted as part of the application to the College of Graduate Studies. Submit a one-page statement of purpose explaining your reason for pursuing this graduate certificate and your commitment to working with individuals with disabilities. This is submitted as part of the application to the College of Graduate Studies. Must demonstrate proficiency in Oral and Written Communications, College Level Math, Critical Thinking and Information Technology through coursework taken within the last ten years or through examination.
Program name: Graduate Certificate in Teaching: Special Education

Requirements: The certificate program in Technical Communication is open to anyone who has earned a bachelor's degree from an accredited institution. Applicants may be concurrently enrolled in other graduate programs at MNSU. To be admitted, students must be accepted by the College of Graduate Studies and Research. Application information may be found at the College of Graduate Studies website. To apply to the Technical Communication Graduate Certificate Program, students must apply online at GradCAS. For more specific instructions, follow the directions on the GradCAS website. Applicants must submit an application form, a statement of purpose, and one transcript from each college and university attended. No GRE score is required for admission to the Technical Communication Graduate Certificate Program.
Program name: Graduate Certificate in Technical Communication

Requirements: In addition to the University's admission requirements, this program requires: Application for Admission. Statement of Purpose. A one to two page essay outlining professional and educational goals and how this certificate will help achieve those goals. It should also describe the applicant’s experience in the aging field. The statement of purpose will be evaluated on the quality of writing and the congruence of applicant goals with program goals. Bachelor’s degree. From a regionally accredited university or college with a minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale. Two letters of recommendation. From people who can attest to applicant’s potential for success in graduate study.
Program name: Postgraduate Certificate in Aging Studies
